MPC

Class mpc

  • java.lang.Object
    • MPC.mpc

  • public class mpc
extends java.lang.Object
    mpc stands for Mini-Pascal Ccompiler. It is the driver class that parses command line arguments and initializes and invokes the compiler phases.
    Author:
    Eliot Moss, Copyright 2003-2004

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MPCContext context
      Compilation context for this run; generally should not access it as a static, but it should be passed to the phase, etc.
      static MPCStream errStream
      Stream to receive error output; generally System.err.
      static int NOT_YET_ASSIGNED
      Flag value for "not yet assigned"
      static Parser parser
      The Parser instantiated for this input file.
      static MPCStream verbStream
      Stream to receive verbose output; generally the same as errStream, which is typically System.err.

      mpc()

      • flag

        public static boolean flag(MPCContext.Flag flag)
        Convenient short-hand for testing flags
        Parameters:
        flag - to test
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the flag is set

      • getRootPart

        private static java.lang.String getRootPart(java.lang.String base)
        Extracts the root (basename) part of a filename
        Parameters:
        base - the String from which to extract the root part
        Returns:
        the root part String

      • makeFilename

        private static java.lang.String makeFilename(java.lang.String base,
                                             java.lang.String ext)
        Constructs a filename given an original name and a new extension. An extension is the part after the dot in a filename; thus pas is the extension in the name "foo.pas".
        Parameters:
        base - The original filename String; may or may not have an extension
        ext - The desired new extension String
        Returns:
        The String giving a filename formed by replacing (or adding) the new extension to the base filename

      • makeMPCStream

        public static MPCStream makeMPCStream(java.lang.String base,
                                      java.lang.String ext,
                                      java.lang.String which)
        Tries to open the file that makeFilename builds; prints error message and returns null if it fails.
        Parameters:
        base - The original filename String
        ext - The extension for the new file
        which - Short description of which output file (for error messages)
        Returns:
        An open MPCStream for output to the file, or null if there is an error

      • processCommandLineFlags

        private static void processCommandLineFlags(java.lang.String flags)
        Goes through flag letters, adjusting debug and output controls as appropriate.
        Parameters:
        flags - Command line argument String containing flags, including leading '-'.

      • printUsage

        private static void printUsage(java.io.PrintStream ps)
        Prints a "usage" message, describing how to invoke mpc and the available command line arguments and flags.
        Parameters:
        ps - Where to print the "usage" message.

      • showFlags

        private static void showFlags(java.io.PrintStream ps)
        Displays (to an output) the current mpc flag settings.
        Parameters:
        ps - Where to display the flag settings.

      • openInputStream

        private static java.io.InputStream openInputStream(java.lang.String inName)
        Processes command line argument that gives the input filename. Tries name as is, then with extension p and extension pas. Terminates processing if it cannot find a file and open it successfully.
        Parameters:
        inName - Initial name for file to try to open.
        Returns:
        An opened input stream to the Pascal input file.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the "main" method of the Mini-Pascal Compiler. If invoked with an empty command line, it will offer help describing its command line format and available flags.
        Parameters:
        args - The command line arguments String[]

      • ShowError

        public static void ShowError(int pos,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Prints an error message given also a line number in the input file.
        Parameters:
        pos - The input position of the start of the error; first line is 1
        message - The error message to print
        See Also:
        InputPos
